comment.shortText: Creates a `setInterval` that is properly cleaned up when a component unmounted

comment.text: an function run on each interval

mdx.rawBody: an function run on each interval

markdownRemark.rawMarkdownBody: an function run on each interval

comment.text: The milliseconds duration of the interval

mdx.rawBody: The milliseconds duration of the interval

markdownRemark.rawMarkdownBody: The milliseconds duration of the interval

markdownRemark.html:
Creates a setInterval that is properly cleaned up when a component unmounted

 function Timer() {
   const [timer, setTimer] = useState(0)
   useInterval(() => setTimer(i => i + 1), 1000)

   return <span>{timer} seconds past</span>
 }

comment.shortText: Creates a pausable `setInterval` that is properly cleaned up when a component unmounted

comment.text: an function run on each interval

mdx.rawBody: an function run on each interval

markdownRemark.rawMarkdownBody: an function run on each interval

comment.text: The milliseconds duration of the interval

mdx.rawBody: The milliseconds duration of the interval

markdownRemark.rawMarkdownBody: The milliseconds duration of the interval

comment.text: Whether or not the interval is currently running

mdx.rawBody: Whether or not the interval is currently running

markdownRemark.rawMarkdownBody: Whether or not the interval is currently running
markdownRemark.html: Whether or not the interval is currently running

Creates a pausable setInterval that is properly cleaned up when a component unmounted

 const [paused, setPaused] = useState(false)
 const [timer, setTimer] = useState(0)

 useInterval(() => setTimer(i => i + 1), 1000, paused)

 return (
   <span>
     {timer} seconds past

     <button onClick={() => setPaused(p => !p)}>{paused ? 'Play' : 'Pause' }</button>
   </span>
)

comment.shortText:
Creates a pausable `setInterval` that _fires_ immediately and is
properly cleaned up when a component unmounted

comment.text: an function run on each interval

mdx.rawBody: an function run on each interval

markdownRemark.rawMarkdownBody: an function run on each interval

markdownRemark.rawMarkdownBody: The milliseconds duration of the interval

mdx.rawBody: Whether or not the interval is currently running

markdownRemark.rawMarkdownBody: Whether or not the interval is currently running
markdownRemark.html: Whether or not the interval is currently running

comment.text:
Whether to run the function immediately on mount or unpause
rather than waiting for the first interval to elapse

mdx.rawBody:
Whether to run the function immediately on mount or unpause
rather than waiting for the first interval to elapse

markdownRemark.rawMarkdownBody:
Whether to run the function immediately on mount or unpause
rather than waiting for the first interval to elapse
markdownRemark.html: Whether to run the function immediately on mount or unpause rather than waiting for the first interval to elapse

mdx.rawBody: Creates a pausable `setInterval` that _fires_ immediately and is properly cleaned up when a component unmounted ```tsx const [timer, setTimer] = useState(-1) useInterval(() => setTimer(i => i + 1), 1000, false, true) // will update to 0 on the first effect return {timer} seconds past ```

markdownRemark.rawMarkdownBody: Creates a pausable `setInterval` that _fires_ immediately and is properly cleaned up when a component unmounted ```tsx const [timer, setTimer] = useState(-1) useInterval(() => setTimer(i => i + 1), 1000, false, true) // will update to 0 on the first effect return {timer} seconds past ```
markdownRemark.html:
Creates a pausable setInterval that fires immediately and is properly cleaned up when a component unmounted

 const [timer, setTimer] = useState(-1)
 useInterval(() => setTimer(i => i + 1), 1000, false, true)

 // will update to 0 on the first effect
 return <span>{timer} seconds past</span>
